Node.definition: = exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
literally: to pour out a treaty; hence, possibly: = action by which two parties establish a union or association for mutual benefit, accompanied by a libation to a deity
= a union or association formed between two or more partners for mutual benefit

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= king of Egypt

Node.gloss: to take refuge|to find refuge|to find shelter
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= king of Egypt
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done
= town; ◄ located in Nile (יְאֹר) delta of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) ► Egyptian capital during 21st and 22nd dynasties; administrative centre of Lower Egypt
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= town; ◄ in Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) located on an island in the Nile (יְאֹר) south of Memphis (מֹף)
literally: to touch; hence: = process or action by which humans or substances arrive at a certain location

Node.gloss: to become repulsive|to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = process by which humans become repulsive or loathsome to someone else ◄ as a result of antagonistic actions ► resulting in enmity between the parties involved|= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)

= an area of land located in the south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples initially by the Canaanites in Arad (עֲרָד) and the Amelekites (עֲמָלֵקִי) later, the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
= male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ seen as a strong and fearless animal
exact meaning unknown: = type of viper; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with lurking danger

= reddish brown viper with a pale underside and a row of pale blotches arranged side by side in pairs all the way down its back; it grows to about 80 centimeters in length, and its head is smaller and its body thinner than most typical vipers; it is easily provoked and quite aggressive; it is active mainly in the daytime, as it can stand higher temperatures than many other snakes; it lives in desert and grassland areas and feeds on jerboas, mice, and mole rats; its venom is slow acting but highly poisonous; ◄ |iEchis coloratus|i*; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with lurking danger
= action by which a winged living creature moves through the air by flapping its wings
literally: to cause to hold, carry; hence: = causative action by which humans take hold of objects and bring them to another location
literally: shoulder (of animal); hence: = the place where an animal carries its loads, which is on its back
= young male donkey (חֲמֹור) ≈ possibly associated with liveliness and unruliness
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= rounded protuberance on the back of a camel or dromedary

= large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten
= valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well being
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
literally: empty; hence: = state in which an event does not serve a useful purpose and is bound to fail
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= small, flat tablet, ◄ made of stone, ► on which words were scratched with a stylus; ≈ associated with conditions that are permanent and are not likely to change
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage

Node.gloss: to carve|to portray|to draw|to mark out|to write
Node.definition: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= an adverb that specifies unending time
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= action by which humans say things that not true in order to deceive or mislead others
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which someone is willing to do something
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to be smooth; hence: = state in which an event appears to be well intentioned, though actually being insincere

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= words that are untrue ► and intended to deceive other people
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = action by which humans deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a structure loses its inner strength and falls apart
= process by which part of a construction such as a wall bends outward which will eventually cause the entire structure to collapse

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= earthenware vessel, ► used as a storage container for liquids like wine and olive oil
literally: of a potter; hence: = pottery made of fired clay
= causative action by which humans use excessive power to break an object into little pieces
= state in which an event is relatively low in intensity ◄ as if being merciful
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place
= fragments of a broken pot

= piece of baked clay; often with sharp, jagged edges; ◄ part of a broken earthenware vessel; ► can be used for activities like scooping water, carrying hot coals, scraping oneself, and wounding oneself in order to express one's sorrow; ≈ symbol of dryness
= causative action by which humans take small objects from a particular location with an object shaped like a shovel ► in order to transfer them to another location

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= a place where fire is lit and maintained, ► for various purposes
= causative action by which humans take a liquid out of a relatively large container with the help of a smaller one
= a depression at the bottom of a waterbody, ► where water can still be found even when most of the water has dried up

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: turning; hence: = process by which humans change their mind about a certain matter, ► which usually results in a different course of action
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be at ease|to be calm
Node.definition: = state in which humans feel confident and calm ◄ either because living under favorable circumstances or because of lack of fear when living under difficult circumstances
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state in which someone is willing to do something

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)
= state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy
= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= state in which a countable entity is five in number
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= set of particles linking two events and denoting that X will continue up to the moment that Y has taken place
= state in which humans, animals, or objects remain in a certain place after part of the original quantity has been located elsewhere
= pole; ► used to carry a banner
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= action by which deities prepare themselves to intervene, ◄ as if rising from a sitting position

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans
= action by which deities make themselves unavailable
= someone who imparts knowledge to other people

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= someone who imparts knowledge to other people
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= action by which humans turn to the right, when walking or performing another event; ≈ in extension: to choose one option as opposed to another
= action by which humans turn to the left (שְׂמֹאל) when walking or performing another event; ≈ in extension: to choose one option as opposed to another

= causative action by which humans cause others to become contaminated, ◄ as a result of unlawful activities, ► which often results in their inability to participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= thin layer of precious metal ► for covering artifacts
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= thin object covering something else, either entirely or in part
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= causative action by which humans cause a substance or a set of small objects to divide itself and move into various directions

Node.gloss: menstruous woman|menstrual discharge|filthy things = objects stained by menstruation|menstruous cloth
Node.definition: = female person discharging blood and other material from the lining of the uterus at intervals of about one lunar month; ≈ regarded as ritually unclean|= blood and other material from the lining of the uterus discharged from the body in the menstrual period; ≈ regarded as unclean|= an unspecified object ► brought in contact to a woman undergoing menstruation; ≈ regarded as unclean|= piece of cloth ► worn or touched by a woman undergoing menstruation; ≈ regarded as unclean

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
= a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= state in which plants and their products are full of the juices and condiments that cause them to be of a good quality and in a healthy condition
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats
= state in which an object is large in size
= generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing
= young male donkey (חֲמֹור) ≈ possibly associated with liveliness and unruliness

Node.gloss: to work|to till|to plow (soil, flax)|to dress (a vineyard)
Node.definition: literally, to serve; therefore = action by which workers prepare land of planting and harvesting; also refers to caring for a vineyard, processing linen, or using cattle for working the land

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= mixture ◄ consisting of entire plants, including leaves, stalks, and grain; ► served as food for domestic animals
= state in which animal food has been mixed with salt ► in order to make it more tasty
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans throw grain into the air so that the wind will remove the chaff

= wooden implement with a long, flat blade attached to a long handle, ► for throwing threshed grain into the air so that the wind might separate the straw and chaff from the grain; ≈ winnowing is often used as a figure of speech to denote the process of distinguishing between good and bad

= wooden fork like implement, with five to seven prongs, ► for throwing threshed grain into the air so that the wind might separate the straw and chaff from the grain; ≈ winnowing is often used as a figure of speech to denote the process of distinguishing between good and bad
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)

Node.gloss: to become high|to be lifted up
Node.definition: = process by which an object increases in height
= a relatively large quantity of liquid flowing with strength
= course of impetuously flowing water; ≈ probably evokes the image of seasonal streams fed by rain, assuring agricultural growth, a sign of God's blessing

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= the killing of people in a cruel and violent way
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a structure loses its inner strength and falls apart
= relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
literally: the hot one; hence: = the heavenly body from which the earth derives its light and warmth; ≈ associated with light and, by extension, with happiness

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
literally: the hot one; hence: = the heavenly body from which the earth derives its light and warmth; ≈ associated with light and, by extension, with happiness
= state in which an event is to be repeated seven times

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to wrap|to bandage|to tie|to bind up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans wrap something around an inanimate object
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= injury, ◄ usually sustained by being struck with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to burn; hence: = process by which events such as evil and anger happen with intensity and with consequences, as if it were fire
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which an event is intense

Node.gloss: to be filled > to be engaged
Node.definition: literally: to be filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which humans are fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
literally: (God's) breath; hence: = process by which humans are punished by God, ◄ described as a flaming breath coming from his mouth
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride
= state in which a substance extends to one half of an area
see נוף (נוף)

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= a shallow, flat circular container with a mesh bottom made of straw, cord, strips of bark, or reed, through which fine particles can pass while the grain is retained; ► used in the final stage of the winnowing process; ≈ winnowing is often used as a figure of speech to denote the process of distinguishing between good and bad

literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue|literally: destruction; hence: = an event that has a great negative impact on one's life, possessions and well being
= set of ropes or leather straps; ► fitted over the head of a horse and connected to the bit (מֶתֶג) used to steer the horse
jaw, cheek
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to convoke (a holy event)|to declare (a holy event)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans call their community together for an event with a religious character, such as worship, fasting, or a holy war
= celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a high pitched wind instrument consisting of a tube with holes along it, ◄ usually made of wood
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes
= state in which humans are exceedingly angry to the extent that it is visible in their appearance
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= hot glowing body of fire

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= object similar to a small stone both in shape and in hardness; ◄ consisting of frozen rain; ► falling from the sky in showers; ≈ often associated with a punishment from God
= pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
literally: stick, rod; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a rod
= a single instance in a range of repeated events
literally: stick; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a stick
literally: foundation; hence: = state of having been determined by God
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= action by which humans or deities engage in a confrontation with (other) humans
= reference to the day before the current day; sometimes used to refer to a point of time in the recent past as if it happened the day before

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use
= causative action by which humans or deities increase the size of an area or object
= quantity of objects lying one on another

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

= a pale yellow substance which burns readily in air; ◄ it is found in regions of vulcanic activity such as the Dead Sea area, and ► causes land to be infertile; ≈ it is associated with punishment from God
= process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire
